item.title: Exploring mTLS in Bug Bounty Programs
item.description: Exploring mTLS in Bug Bounty Programs Today, I will present a case study on mTLS that I conducted in a private bug bounty program. mTLS (Mutual TLS) is a method of mutual authentication that ensures both parties in a network connection are who they claim to be. In an mTLS connection, the server verifies the client’s certificate, and the client verifies the server’s certificate. If a proxy like Burp Suite were used in this connection, the server would reject the connection.
